sense.name: (Cause to) change from a gas to a liquid.
sense.examples: The acid condenses at a specific temperature. The cold air condensed the steam. He condensed the steam in the lab.

sense.name: Make more concise, compact or concentrated.
sense.examples: We have to condense the contents of the book into a summary. Congress condensed the three year plan into six months. Her feelings condensed and she realized what she actually thought. Letting it sit really condenses the flavors.

sense.name: Remove water from a substance.
sense.examples: Condense the milk by boiling. We condensed the soup by simmering it for hours.

sense.name: Develop due to condensation.
sense.examples: All our planets condensed out of the same material. He condensed seemingly out of thin air.
